title: Second Black Box Found at China Eastern Plane Crash Site, State Media Says; All 132 people who were aboard the Boeing 737 have been confirmed dead
text:
Xinhua noted the discovery of the flight data recorder in a one-line report Sunday morning that didn't provide additional details.

All 132 people who were aboard the Boeing 737 when it crashed into a mountainside in southern China's Guangxi region have been confirmed dead, the Chinese civil aviation regulator said on Saturday. Aviation experts have been puzzled by the crash, which occurred after one of one of the fastest descents of a commercial aviation jetliner in history.

The cockpit voice and flight data recorders store vital information and typically provide accident investigators the best information about what caused a plane to go down.

Write to Josh Chin at josh.chin@wsj.com

Second Black Box Found at China Eastern Plane Crash Site, State Media Says
